wikipedia_page.main: Ben Greenwood (born 30 July 1984 in Nether Kellet, Lancashire) is a British road racing cyclist who is now a coach with the Great Britain Cycling Team. Originally from Lancashire he now lives in Cheshire and has also represented Scotland. A former member of the Great Britain Under-23 Academy, he has also been a member of the Rapha Condor–Sharp team, and won the Under-23 British Road Championship and the hill climb championship in 2005. He also competed in the Under-23 road race at the 2006 UCI Road World Championships in Salzburg, Austria.

response: In August 2005, a cycle race, the Clitheroe Grand Prix, took place in the town, with Russell Downing finishing ahead of Chris Newton. In August 2006, Ben Greenwood won, with Ian Wilkinson second, but in April 2007, the council decided not to support another event, citing poor attendance. The town was also the start point of the second stage of the 2015 Tour of Britain.
